According to discussions in an online forum at heise.de, this error occurs when
installing the Platform and JDT runtime binaries only, not(!) the SDK. The
"workaround" suggested there was to download the SDK instead of the binaries.
I'm using Java 1.4.2_07. and getting the same error after installing the binary
versions only, not the SDK. As a non-DSL internet user I'd really appreciate a
solution that does not mean to download the 100MB SDK via ISDN ...

(In reply to comment #1)
> I'd really appreciate a solution that does not mean to download the 100MB SDK

I found a workaround that works with "re-using" some files from my previous
3.1M6 installation. I copied the three files .bundledata.3, .lazy.3 and .state.3
from <base>/configuration/org.eclipse.osgi into the same directory in my 3.1
release installation (where smaller files named .bundledata.1, .lazy.1 and
.state.1 already existed from the errornous startup attempt ...) - and Eclipse
3.1 Release finally started up easily and without any errors!!!
After closing Eclipse, all files listed above were replaced by a new file set
.bundledata.2, .lazy.2 and .state.2.

There should be any issues with running with only the platform and JDT binaries.

Where did you extract the Platform and JDT drops to? An empty directory? An
existing Eclipse install? The latter is not supported.
Sorry, I meant: "There should *not* be any issues..."

I just tried to recreate what I did yesterday, and found out the following:

I extracted the runtime binaries of 
 - platform 3.1 win32
 - JDT 3.1
 - emf sdo I200506230200
 - xsd I200506230200
 - GEF 3.1 RC4
 - JEM SKD I20050623 (with source + sdk parts removed from features + plugins)

I added three more plugins
 - Quantum 3.0.0 (extracted com.quantum.feature_3.0.0.bin.dist.zip)
 - de.hunsicker.jalopy.plugin.eclipse_0.2.7 (copied from 3.1M6 + WST M4 inst.)
 - de.mvmsoft.checkclipse_1.6.0 (copied from 3.1M6 + WST M4 installation)

Then I ran this brand new installation against an existing workspace with
some existing project formerly worked on using 3.1M6 + WST M4. Today this
worked fine ...

.. so I checked out what I could have done wrong yesterday and found out
that if you use my old config.ini from the 3.1M6 + WST M4 installation,
the reported error occurs. 

The new (and right) config.ini just differs at one line: osgi.bundles=[...]
was commented out in the previous versions and now is active. If I take my
clean and working installation from today, remove all configuration subdirs
and comment out this single line in the config.ini, I get the error message
described above again. If I make that line active, everything works fine.

So I have to say sorry for making such trouble - I must have copied the
configuration directory from my old installation; don't know why I did so,
but this is the only possible explanation I have for getting that error.
Ok. If you happen to reproduce it with a valid scenario, please reopen.

I am facing the same problem when I used 3.1.1 Maintenance Build: M20050923-1430
on Windows XP SP2, JDK 1.4.2_08. Pl. let me know -  is there anything I am missing?
  
Here are the steps to reproduce this bug:

1. Download "org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser" in the workspace from Eclipse
CVS head.

2. Create a feature named "rcp_browser_feature_311" by using "New Project ->
Plug-in Development -> Feature Project" wizard.

3. Choose "org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser" in "Referenced Plug-ins and
Fragments" wizard page.

4.  Add the following plug-ins in the feature:

org.eclipse.core.commands
org.eclipse.core.expressions
org.eclipse.core.runtime
org.eclipse.help
org.eclipse.jface
org.eclipse.osgi
org.eclipse.swt
org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86
org.eclipse.ui
org.eclipse.ui.workbench


5. Choose "rcp_browser_feature_311" in the Package Explorer and select "Export
-> Deployable Features".

6. "rcp_browser_feature_311" will already be checked under "Available Features".

7. Choose radio button "Directory" and give a temporary location, like
"C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311".

8. Check box "Package feature and plugins as individual JAR ..."

9. Click on Finish.

10. This will create "C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311" folder.

11. Put <3.1.1 eclipse home>\startup.jar in C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311.

The directory structure will be like following:

C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311
   startup.jar
   -features
      rcp_browser_feature_311_1.0.0.jar
   -plugins
      org.eclipse.core.commands_3.1.0.jar
      org.eclipse.core.expressions_3.1.0.jar
      org.eclipse.core.runtime_3.1.1.jar
      org.eclipse.help_3.1.0.jar
      org.eclipse.jface_3.1.1.jar
      org.eclipse.osgi_3.1.1.jar
      org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86_3.1.1.jar
      org.eclipse.swt_3.1.0.jar
      org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser_3.0.0.jar
      org.eclipse.ui.workbench_3.1.1.jar
      org.eclipse.ui_3.1.1.jar

12. cd to C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311 and run either:

C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311>java -cp startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main 
-product org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser.product


C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311>java -cp startup.jar org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main 
-application org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser.app

13. The above step is failing and generating
"C:\temp\rcp_browser_feature_311\configuration\<xxx>.log file. The content of
the file is like following:

!SESSION 2005-09-26 10:26:30.931 -----------------------------------------------
eclipse.buildId=unknown
java.version=1.4.2_08
java.vendor=Sun Microsystems Inc.
BootLoader constants: OS=win32, ARCH=x86, WS=win32, NL=en_US
Framework arguments:  -application org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser.app
Command-line arguments:  -application org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser.app

!ENTRY org.eclipse.osgi 2005-09-26 10:26:31.666
!MESSAGE Application error
!STACK 1
java.lang.IllegalStateException: Unable to acquire application service.
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:367)
	at org.eclipse.core.runtime.adaptor.EclipseStarter.run(EclipseStarter.java:163)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)
	at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:39)
	at
sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)
	at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:324)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.invokeFramework(Main.java:334)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.basicRun(Main.java:278)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.run(Main.java:973)
	at org.eclipse.core.launcher.Main.main(Main.java:948)

You are missing a configuration/config.ini file.  In your scenario this file 
needs to at least have the following properties set:

osgi.bundles=org.eclipse.core.runtime@2:start,\
 org.eclipse.core.commands,\
 org.eclipse.core.expressions,\
 org.eclipse.help,\
 org.eclipse.jface,\
 org.eclipse.swt,\
 org.eclipse.swt.win32.win32.x86,\
 org.eclipse.ui,org.eclipse.ui.workbench

eclipse.product=org.eclipse.ui.examples.rcp.browser.product


Using the Product Configuration wizard should help you with exporting a 
runnable product with the correct configuration.
